I would like to know why you'd say that though? Genuinely asking. My knowledge of Rodriguez stretches way before the documentary was conceived and I will never forget the day my dad told me the story. As far as I know he never knew and I doubt that they would hide the fact for dramatic effect. If that was ever the case South Africans would've called bullshit on it long ago

As a South African I can say I pretty much grew up on his music. My dad and his friends had bootleg tapes of him when they were in the border war. Usually the women back home would have to make and send these tapes by mail as his music was banned over here at one stage. It was actually more of a shock to us that he didn't know he was famous.

Web developer here. PHP is an excellent start. If you really keep at it and use your free time to learn more you'll be raking it in within 4-5 years. I was earning minimum wage as well at 28. Today I'm 32 and making about 60k a year. Was a shit ton of hard work but it paid off. Last piece of advice would be if you're doing PHP, get to know a bit of front-end as well. As long as you know the basic with FE, you're good to go. Good luck!

WRITING.TEXT: Interior shots are all done in a sound studio. Watch the video here to get a bit more background on the set of Bates: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/03/10/arts/television/spending-the-night-inside-bates-motel.html?_r=0

I watched Psycho for the first time 3 seasons into Bates and I would definitely recommend watching the movie. It was great to see some of the subtle references from the movie being brought into play in the series. It also made me realise exactly of what's to come in season 5. Even if you don't watch the series, Psycho is a great film.

WRITING.TITLE: Is it safe to say that we may not see Kim Wexler in the next season?
WRITING.TEXT: I think that the closer we get to Saul Goodman being introduced, there may not be a need for Kim's character anymore. She's essential to the plot as it currently stands, but we all know where Saul Goodman will end up and I don't see how Kim helps to get him to that point. Your thoughts?

Chuck's been waiting for a moment like this for a very long time. Kim having MV is actually Jimmy having MV in Chuck's mind. His face lit up like a childs when he realised he can screw with Jimmy's life. The MV meeting really was an attack on Jimmy, not Kim.

When Howard tells Kim she's got her hands full in doc review... scene changes showing the flag waving in the wind. It looks like Kim is standing at attention, showing full loyalty like we do when a country's flag gets hoisted. Almost patriotic like.
http://imgur.com/9AcEKBT
She can leave when she wants, she's got no reason to stay at HHM. Wonder why she's so loyal to them.

WRITING.TITLE: Ever notice Mike in the background of the BCS poster?

WRITING.TEXT: I agree with you on point A (probably because it leans somewhat more to the point I tried to make). I'm just slightly cautious because by now we are very aware of the easter eggs in Breaking Bad and BCS. I've gone from just watching BB to watching BCS expecting every scene to have some sort of meaning or easter egg

Anybody else notice that the scene where Kim sit's way in the back and Jimmy walks in could be a representation on how she feels about him at that point? Anybody? Or am I looking into this way more than I should?
http://i.imgur.com/cD1bLVz.jpg
As a South African I can confirm this
Agreed! After watching "Talking Saul" I found Kim to be hotter though

Agree with what you said. My theory is that:
1) it's also a clue into the black and white "Cinnabon" scenes. Maybe down the line close to the end of the series he gets arrested and jailed. The Cinnabon job could be some parole condition. When he hesitates to open the emergency exit it shows that he's turned his life around. The evolution from Slippin' Jimmy to Saul Goodman to Good Guy Saul.
2) The Cinnabon job is his escape to obscurity (now on the run) and knowing that the police will come when he opens the door, he doesn't want an authority figure to maybe recognize him?
